page.title: 05Roads & Traffic in Warcop
page.content: Only one major road, the A66 between Workington and Middlesborough, passes through our block. It is a busy route which used to be a Roman road. There has been a lot of improvements on the road recently, with by-passes being built around villages like Brough, and Appleby. There is a secondary road, the B6259, which also passes through our block, joining the A66 and Kirkby Stephen. Most of the roads in the area are small, single track roads, mostly used by farm vehicles like tractors and cattle wagons. There is only one bus service, on the A66; the bus that came through Warcop once a week has just been stopped. This means that many people have to buy their own car, or ask for lifts if they want to get anywhere.
